properties.description: GreyNoiseThreatIntelligence data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: GreyNoise2Sentinel (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: This Data Connector installs an Azure Function app to download GreyNoise indicators once per day and inserts them into the ThreatIntelligenceIndicator table in Microsoft Sentinel.

sampleQueries.query: ThreatIntelligenceIndicator | where SourceSystem == 'GreyNoise'| sort by TimeGenerated desc

dataTypes.name: ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery: ThreatIntelligenceIndicator| where isnotempty(TimeGenerated) and SourceSystem == 'GreyNoise' | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)

value: ThreatIntelligenceIndicator| where SourceSystem == 'GreyNoise' | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated) | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions on the workspace are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

instructionSteps.description: > The following steps create an Azure AAD application, retrieves a GreyNoise API key, and saves the values in an Azure Function App.
instructionSteps.title: You can connect GreyNoise to Microsoft Sentinel by following the below steps:

instructionSteps.description: Generate an API key from GreyNoise Portal https://docs.greynoise.io/docs/using-the-greynoise-api
instructionSteps.title: 1. Retrieve API Key from GreyNoise Portal.

instructionSteps.description: Follow the instructions here to create your Azure AAD app and save your Client ID, Client Secret and Tenant ID: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/connect-threat-intelligence-upload-api#instructions
instructionSteps.title: 2. Create an Azure Active Directory (AAD) application and acquire Tenant ID, Client ID and Client Secret.

instructionSteps.description:
Click the Deploy to Azure button below

	 [![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2FAzure-Sentinel%2Fa531176934d67267585713f73a777cedb3bbc4c1%2FSolutions%2FGreyNoise%2FData%2520Connectors%2Fazuredeploy_Connector_GreyNoiseAPISentinel_AzureFunction.json)
instructionSteps.title: 3. Deploy the Azure Function

instructionSteps.description:
You can send indicators by calling our Upload Indicators API. For more information about the API, click here. 

>HTTP method: POST 

>Endpoint: https://sentinelus.azure-api.net/workspaces/{WORKSPACEID}/threatintelligenceindicators:upload?api-version=2022-07-01  

>WORKSPACEID: the workspace that the indicators are uploaded to  (can be copied from the following).  


>Header Value 1: "Authorization" = "Bearer [AAD Access Token from step 1]" 


> Header Value 2: "Content-Type" = "application/json"  
 
>Body: The body is a JSON object containing an array of indicators in STIX format. For more information about the API, click here
instructionSteps.title: 4. Send indicators to Sentinel
